thread.title: Antonio Conte reveals struggles with long-term Chelsea project amid job security fears
thread.title_full: Antonio Conte reveals struggles with long-term Chelsea project amid job security fears

author: simon johnson
title: Antonio Conte reveals struggles with long-term Chelsea project amid job security fears
text:
Hollywood star Bill Paxton dies aged 61 
Antonio Conte believes it is now hard for any manager to instigate a long-term plan because clubs give them such little time. 
Conte was furious at the news that Claudio Ranieri was sacked last week , less than nine months after taking Leicester to a shock Premier League title triumph. 
The former Italy coach is firmly on course to take Chelsea to the League trophy this term in his first season in charge. 
Conte was given a three-year deal when he joined last summer, but admits it's difficult to have a plan for the future in place when job security can be under threat after a few bad results. Chelsea analysis: Fabregas delivers as Llorente proves credentials 
He said: "I think in this type of modern football, it's not easy to start a project and to be sure you will stay a long time in the same team. But honestly not only for me, for all coaches. 
"If you have the possibility to stay for many years in the same team, then you can work to improve your idea, to improve your players, but the result in football is very important. In Pictures | Chelsea vs Swansea | 25/02/2017 In Pictures | Chelsea vs Swansea | 25/02/2017 1/32
